content: Dividends Investments REITs SeedlyTV EP05 Asked by AnonymousAsked on 15 May 2019My question is, what do I do with my dividends as they are in small amounts and cant be easily reinvested into most companies. Any advice on what to do with my dividends? and also any areas I can improve on regarding my portfolio.Hello, I'm 19 this year and just started investing, I've put in roughly $2k SGD into my vickers account. I've diversified slightly into a few sectors but mainly REITs. I've also started a RSF, to buy NIKKO AM STI ETF.5 answersAnswerBump1
Answers (5)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Vincent Tan Wen Bin, Assistant Vice President at Thinkers AllianceLevel 5. GeniusAnswered on 22 May 2019I would open a separate account and collect all those dividends. I will use it to reinvest into the counters when opportunity arises. You might want to explore a bit into other markets such as etfs, bond funds to balance out your portfolio.0 comments0

Edwin KohLevel 2. RookieAnswered on 20 May 2019It might be small but just treat it as you have extra cash to spoilt yourself. It just the start of the journey , don‚Äôt expect it to be big. Slowly as years goes by , the effect of compounding will surely grow it into a sizeable amount. So for now just treat it as a discount in your expenses from time to time.0 comments0

Serene TohLevel 5. GeniusAnswered on 16 May 2019I treat it as extra income (same as bank interest) then just save it aside it to accummulates enough to invest.Translate from chinese (mosquito meat, not matter how small is still meat)As you say, you've only just started, so this will only grow with time. Remember the compounding curve. This is just the begining. Jia you.0 comments0

Gabriel Tham, Kenichi Tag Team Member at Tag TeamLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 15 May 2019Don't just see it as a way to reinvest.See the small dividends as a way to offset your bills too!If your phone bill is $20, then $20 covers it! Free phone usage!0 comments0

HC Tang, Financial Enthusiast, Budgeting at The SocietyLevel 8. WizardUpdated on 07 Jun 2019Since it's small, combine it with your RSP and plan to progressively increase your monthly investment amount.2 comments0
Winshern Ho15 May 2019Keep it in your warchest. Deploy it when the amount is sizeable again.HC Tang15 May 2019üòÉüëç
